email_content:
Hi Emily,

It’s always lovely to hear from you! Thanks for asking about my daily life at Sterling & Locke — it’s definitely kept me on my toes, but I really enjoy it.

A typical day looks something like this:
• 9:00 AM – I ease into the morning by reviewing each client’s portfolio and flagging anything that needs attention.
• 10:30 AM – We have a short team huddle where we dissect the latest market trends and share any interesting cases. It’s collaborative and fast-paced — I learn something new every day.
• Lunch around 1:00 PM – usually with a few teammates so we can swap stories (and occasionally debate whose cuisine reigns supreme!).
• 2:00 PM – Deep-dive time: I prep financial statements or fine-tune reports. This is the part I call my “number-puzzle” slot because solving accounting discrepancies feels a lot like cracking a code.
• 4:00 PM – Client meetings. Talking through their goals and explaining the numbers in plain language is my favourite part — it makes all the spreadsheets feel real.
• 6:00 PM – Wrap-up, note tomorrow’s priorities, and head home.

Even though the schedule is structured, no two days are exactly alike. Cultural-wise, I notice we have a fairly flat hierarchy; juniors can question seniors openly, which I’m told isn’t the norm everywhere. It took me a while to get used to that level of informality, but now I really appreciate how it sparks new ideas.

How about you? What’s a day in your world like these days? Any new cultural quirks you’ve observed that surprised you?

Looking forward to hearing more!

Warm regards,
Jane
